comments.commentBody: Congressman John Lewis from Georgia is correct.  There is no place on the floor of Congress for the behavior instigated by John A. Boehner which he attempts to mask as something other than what it is....blatant racism.  Mr. Boehner has been the catalyst for impeding the business of Congress throughout President Obama's term in office.  It is time for John A. Boehner to leave Congress.  Enough is enough of this man thinking he can abuse his power at the expense of the American people.  GET HIM OUT, PLEASE! AND SOON!
Considering how advanced Israel's military is, if Israel wanted to slaughter Arabs believe me you'd know it.  What do you think this is? Syria or Iraq or Libya?

"Do these House Republicans have NOTHING better to do than this???"

When the item at the top of your agenda is to demonstrate that government doesn't work, by not allowing it to work....then the answer to the question is a resounding NO!!!
How much will the lawyers cost the tax-payer?
And bring a chair, some water, snacks, and a jacket, like you were camping out for U2 tickets or waiting for the iPhone 6; the white male supremacists will try to limit our right to vote.

The American electorate in less than 100 days will have the opportunity to make a decision about whether to continue these folks in their legislative offices or recognize the ungovernable mess that has become the United States government. Be sure you are properly registered, be sure to vote, and encourage your friends, family, and neighbors to do the same. All other hand wringing, appeals to "reason," or spurious excuses for the Republican Party count for nought.

And what a list it is.  The Syrians and Isis have killed more than 100,000 of their own people, and the Iranians are developing atomic weapons.  And of course the Gazans actually elected Hamas.  But the list could go on and on.

"The fact that some Arab dictators with plenty of blood on their hands have come down for Netanyahu rather than Hamas is purely for reasons of realpolitik, having nothing to do with morality or ethics"

morality or ethics only one side of the us foreign policy coin; the other side is realpolitik. remember james monroe and the monroe doctrine? no european colonialism in the western hemisphere. And almost one hundred years later teddy roosevelt stood ready to apply it with gunboats flying the stars and stripes. so you can sill be a patriotic american and embrace national interest.

And Abbas is no moderate. He still wants to flood Israel with these so-called Palestinian refugees.
The car augment proves our society can function logically. Prior to reading this article I didn't think that was possible.  Thank you Nicholas.

You realize of course that layoffs sweeping across the nation should show up in first-time unemployment benefit applications, right? These happen to be at a 6-year low, so I have to say that your statement is patently false. You will always find examples of specific stores/brands letting people go. The only system where that is not true is a state-run system, which I am sure you are not advocating.
As for the part-time job thing, that has been debunked approximately 15000 times. The part-time/full-time job mix is based on the household survey which happens to be extremely volatile. When looking at a longer-term trend it becomes clear that the vast majority of jobs are in fact full-time positions.
You might also want to consider the fact that the unemployed-to-job-openings ratio, which is currently at 2.1 is the best it's been in 5 years, which doesn't really mesh with your claiming that employers won't hire.
Overall there has been real improvement in the labor market by just about any reasonable measure. Hopefully the slack is out soon and the workforce-to-population ratio can recover a bit.
We'll get another hint Friday...

I'm sure Boenhner remembers the bar room archetype:

The bluff, blustery guy who threatens a fight, looking pleadingly for someone to intervene and "hold him back...".

Exactly what the Big Bad Boenhner is doing.

This political Kabuki is a sad charade.

No action before the election in November? Odd timing.

He had his ducks lined up weeks ago when he first threatened to sue the President.

Why the slow pace?

The man is shameless and a liar. Party of Lincoln?
Lincoln Town Car.

The latest Triumph-of-the-Low-Information voter is the belief that a presidential-recall is somehow codified in the Constitution and that this childish vote by the House is the first step in an inevitable change in POTUS --BEFORE-- the next in the long, long line of regular, orderly constitutional national elections that have resulted in the oldest, and most stable [as of now] government in the world.  Whee!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Yeah, we know; we noticed a long time ago when they were rattling on about a birth certificates, long and short form, coming from Kenya, or Hawaii not being a state, and lots of other unintelligible mutterings no one could understand outside of the ranters with deplorable spelling. "Keep Your Government Hands off My Medicare" is what sealed the deal for me.

Sweet Holy Moly.. I'm a Republican, but this is just nonsense. You are wasting my hard earned money, that I must pay in silly taxes each paycheck on this? Do you have to a gripe with the President? Ok, then sit down and work it out but holding up legislation and utilizing my money for this... make's me very upset.  It should make all of you upset, too.  This is Kindergarten, folks.  Pre-school at it's, worst.

Prescription drugs should not be advertised either. At one time they were not, as it was thought to be unethical to advertise medicines that need the expertise of a doctor to use safely.  But when Big Business came in, ethics went out the window. I don't think its a coincidence that now the fastest-growing category of drugs abused by young people is prescription drugs.

I know of people who've died of caffeine overdoses.

Like many recreational drugs, coffee is fine to use responsibly. It is quite possible to use it irresponsibly. Advertising should probably be restricted, though.

And caffeine is *quite* addictive for many people. I know quite a lot of caffeine addicts; although the drug doesn't hurt them physically, it does burn a hole in their pocketbooks. Without it, they get cravings, they get withdrawal, they show drug-seeking behavior, they'll drink the dregs in order to get their fix. It's a legal addictive drug.

I agree. Prescription drugs are incredibly valuable, as are over-the-counter drugs. But advertising them with the hard sell, like is done today, can really mess things up by encouraging people to take them who don't need them or really want them.

(This is, incidentally, what happened with the COX-2 inhibitors. They're good drugs *for a specific class of people* who need to take a lot of aspirin but can't tolerate aspirin. They were instead advertised heavily to people who should have been taking aspirin or Tylenol; a bunch of people died, because they're somewhat more dangerous than aspirin, and then they got pulled from the market; disaster all around.)

People who need or want specific drugs can research and find them. Companies should be allowed to hang out a sign on their store, and to have their own websites, and to advertise on the box, and so on.

But the sort of advertising of drugs where they're being pushed to people who aren't seeking them, in places like TV shows and general-interest magazines, really should not be allowed. I'm not sure if the Supreme Court will allow such an advertising restriction, but it's what ought to happen.

I have never smoked pot, never drunk alcohol, never smoked tobacco, and don't even drink coffee.

I think they should all be legal. Prohibition has been a disaster, and has encouraged police departments to turn into violent paramilitaries which break into innocent people's houses on the slightest pretext.

I also think it should be not be legal to advertise any of them. The people who want them will find them; they shouldn't be *pushed*. Alcohol pushers are a major problem in this country, and tobacco pushers used to be a major problem.

House members (I should say, idiots!): You don't sue Presidents. You impeach them if you can.

Try not to look at yourselves in a mirror. It might crack.

Thank you for your attention.
The single issue voter that is uneducated and can't see the forest for the tree.

When will someone in mainstream media just call it what it is...every southern member of the GOP is so racist that they can't bear to have a successful black president as part of "their" American History.  Can't we please just let the hillbillies secede peacefully and be done with it??  Ten Commandments at court houses?  Blowing up Planned Parenthood?  Not accepting Medicaid expansion?  Racists.
Out of Control? How so?
Greg you hit the nail on the head.  This country is a pack of dogs dumbed down by the tube and its commercials selling products nobody needs.  It's a national sickness.

I think we have to condone smoking pot; it has proven medical value (for glaucoma, among other things).

I don't approve of recreational drug use, but people have been doing it since forever, so it's absurd to try to ban it. As long as they're not driving or in charge of anything important while they're intoxicated, it should be legal.

The only possibilities for the divisive impeachment process being cheerful are (a) if, like last time, Republicans then lose seats; (b) if, like last time, the Republican Speaker of the House then steps down with his tail between his legs or; (c) if it's covered by Ms. Collins, who can find the absurd humor in anything.  Welcome back, Gail!

These and other actions continue to erode the credibility of the United States of America.  In our democracy the "loyal opposition" should never concede its values but it should always remain "loyal".  But, since the election of President Obama, there has been a faction of the country which is totally unwilling to acknowledge or accept him as their President.  And then there are those politicians, whose only goal is to stay in power, who will do anything to appease and even agitate their constituents.  Boehner knows he cannot impeach Obama - on what grounds?  Instead, he brings this unwarranted lawsuit.  Is there any wonder that Putin thinks he can skirt International Law, ignore the United States, and disrespect our President and country - he is taking his cues from our own political leaders.  The Republicans are not only damaging themselves and the party brand, they are undermining our country and standing in the world.

did he force the argentine government to accept his terms?  the idea that bond issuers' obligations are only "legally right" - as though there is some other type of "right" embedded in a contract to borrow money - is absurd.  the people of argentina should definitely "take care of" a government that willfully cheats those who loan them money.
I'm waiting for the pro-Palestinian crowd to launch a campaign to demand that Israel halt Iron Dome, abolish bomb shelters, and halt rocket defense drills.

Mr. Khan, interesting that as a believing Muslim you also see something going on the world which isn't the norm or natural. As a believing Jew I can't explain why, or how, but clearly G-d is maneuvering things in tragic, but interesting, ways. The Middle East is roiling, in strange ways, and only fools who think mankind solely controls the world and its destiny are trying to explain everything rationally, but they can't. If anybody would have told me last year the Saudis would be quiet about such a war, I wouldn't have believed it.

As much as I admire and respect Obama, I'm going to blame him as well.  He also has a responsibility to effectively tout his achievements, and be bolder in calling the Republican's the fools they are.

Pathetic.  This country is in a MUCH better place than when Obama took office, and the Republican's get away with this nonsense? I blame Obama's public relations team... who can't seem to effectively get the word out about the achievements of this administration.
